data.title: Michael Stich, Helena Sukova inducted into International Tennis Hall of Fame
meta_keywords: National Assn of Stock Car Auto Racing
data.meta_description: Michael Stich and Helena Sukova were inducted into the International Tennis Hall of Fame in Rhode Island. They were enshrined Saturday during a ceremony on Newport's grass center court outside the hall.
data.text:
Michael Stich and Helena Sukova were inducted into the International Tennis Hall of Fame in Rhode Island. They were enshrined Saturday during a ceremony on Newport's grass center court outside the hall. Stich won Wimbledon in 1991 and a gold medal at the 1992 Barcelona Olympics in doubles with German countryman Boris Becker. Sukova is from the Czech Republic. She captured 14 Grand Slam doubles crowns — nine in women's, five in mixed . . . Third-seeded Steve Johnson beat Marcel Granollers, 6-3, 6-3, to reach the Hall of Fame Tennis Open final. The 28-year-old American will face Ramkumar Ramanathan in the final Sunday morning. Ramanathan, of India, topped American Tim Smyczek, 6-4, 7-5 . . . Fabio Fognini edged Fernando Verdasco for the first time on clay to reach the Swedish Open final against Richard Gasquet . Fognini won, 6-1, 4-6, 7-5, even after losing two break leads in the deciding set of their 2-hour, 17-minute semifinal. He lost his previous three matches with the Spaniard on clay . . . Mandy Minella has a chance at becoming the third mother to win a WTA singles title in the last 12 months after reaching the Ladies Championships Gstaad final. Minella, of Luxembourg, overcame 19-year-old Marketa Vondrousova of the Czech Republic, 4-6, 6-2, 6-2, to reach her first career final at 32.

Basketball

Celtics waive Abdel Nader

The Celtics have waived forward Abdel Nader, a league source confirmed on Saturday. Nader averaged 3 points and 1.5 rebounds in 48 games for Boston as a rookie last season. The Celtics selected him with the 58th overall pick of the 2016 draft and he spent his first pro season playing for the team’s G-League affiliate, the Maine Red Claws. He was named the league’s rookie of the year. Nader had a partial $450,000 guarantee for next season, but his $1.4 million salary would have become fully guaranteed if he was not waived before Aug. 1.

Adam Himmelsbach

Baseball

Familia traded to Oakland

Jeurys Familia has been traded by the New York Mets to the Oakland Athletics for two minor leaguers and international bonus money. The deal was announced before the Mets’ Subway Series game at the Yankees. The Mets get righthander Bobby Wahl, infielder Will Toffey and $1 million in international slot money . . . A day after saying he may need surgery on both heels that would require an eight-to-10-month recovery, Yoenis Cespedes was out of the Mets’ starting lineup because of body soreness and New York’s front office did not publicly comment on his startling health revelation . . . The St. Louis Cardinals placed righthander Carlos Martinez on the 10-day disabled list before a doubleheader against the Chicago Cubs. Martinez, who has dropped his last two starts, has a right oblique strain . . . Colorado Rockies second baseman DJ LeMahieu was placed on the 10-day disabled list with a strained left oblique.

Miscellany

World record walk in London
